Sightings

KCC NMA Student Show

Spotting the elusive multi-skilled creative

Rumored to live in the shadow of Lē‘ahi basking in the warm glow of RGB pixels in their burrows, is an enclave of rare and elusive creatures. Local lore portrays them as multi-talented with skills best described as magical. Members of the creative industry have confirmed the existence of the talented New Media Arts graduate and many have allegedly hired them.

Please join us to marvel at the sighting of these wondrous, talented creatures on the eves of their Portfolio Show and Demo Reel.

About the Events

This year’s Portfolio Show and Demo Reel will take place on two incredible evenings. Both events require RSVP—see the details below. We look forward to seeing you!

“All I’m saying is that you’ve been to the KCC campus and seen what I’ve seen, you’d believe in them too.”

An Anonymous Bystander's account

New Media Arts at KCC

The New Media Arts (NMA) program is a two year AS degree program located at Kapi‘olani Community College (KCC) in Honolulu, Hawaii. The NMA mission is to prepare students for employment in the fields of interface design and animation.
